channel.title: Linus Torvalds releases Linux kernel version 3 to celebrate 20 years of linux
channel.description:
It's been nearly twenty years since Linus Torvalds let loose Linux on an unsuspecting world, and yesterday he finally updated the open source OS kernel to version 3.0. This third iteration, currently named 3.0.0-rc1, comes 15 years after 2.0 first hit the web and brings driver support for Microsoft Kinect -- a move that should have visions of sugar plum fairies (or maybe just Android avatars) dancing in hackers' heads. Also included is code optimized for AMD's Fusion and Intel's Ivy and Sandy Bridge silicon, and some updated graphics drivers, too.
http://www.engadget.com/2011/05/30/linus-torvalds-releases-linux-kernel-version-3-to-celebrate-20-y/ http://www.conceivablytech.com/7683/products/linux-torvalds-approves-linux-3-0-rc1 http://kernel.org/

[quote=“Mopman, post:10, topic:397154”]NOTHING? BUT BUT KINECT SUPPORT

lol[/quote]news was raving about kinect being Linux based… stupid as fuck

Actually, to have written 2% of the code for something so important is quite impressive in my opinion.

item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I think I read somewhere today that only 2% of his original code is in todays distros. I guess that’s not that amazing though looking at how tech has come on.

Good update for Linux users I guess?
